repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - Financial Markets Development
            Technical Assistance Project; Financial Sector Adjustment
            Loan; and First, Second Programmatic Financial Sector
            Adjustment Loan Projects

abstracts.cdata!:
In regard to project performance
            assessment ratings, the Financial Markets Development
            Technical Assistance Project of Colombia had the following
            ratings: outcome was moderately satisfactory; sustainability
            was likely; institutional development impact was modest;
            Bank performance was moderately unsatisfactory; and borrower
            performance was moderately satisfactory. The Financial
            Sector Adjustment Loan had the following ratings: outcome
            was satisfactory; sustainability was likely; institutional
            development impact was substantial; Bank performance was
            moderately unsatisfactory; and borrower performance was
            satisfactory. The First Programmatic Financial Sector
            Adjustment Loan Project had the following ratings: outcome
            was satisfactory; sustainability was likely; institutional
            development impact was substantial; Bank performance was
            satisfactory; and borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Finally, the Second Programmatic Financial Sector Adjustment
            Loan Project had the following ratings: outcome was
            moderately satisfactory; sustainability was likely;
            institutional development impact was substantial; Bank
            performance was satisfactory; and borrower performance was
            satisfactory. Lessons learned from this assessment included:
            accurate, up-to-date sector information and analytical
            knowledge is critical for an adequate support to the
            financial sector; agility and quick reaction to crises
            requires adequate technical resources and streamlined
            decision-making; agility, flexibility, and openness to
            change are also crucial during implementation of a project
            or program; exploiting the synergies among different Bank
            instruments is crucial; and a programmatic approach to
            financial sector reforms is likely to require a time horizon
            of several years to allow for policy and institutional
            reforms to be translated into outcomes and results.

TF022479-PHRD-FINANCIAL SECT.&
            CAPITAL MARKETS,TF030448-SPANISH CTF - FY04 ( LATIN

repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - Second Programmatic Financial
            Sector Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; overall
            Bank performance is satisfactory; and overall Borrower
            performance is highly satisfactory. The report cites the
            following as lessons learned: 1) Improvement in
            macroeconomic performance is an essential precondition for
            success. 2) Sophisticated methodologies for risk management
            have to be implemented at a pace commensurate with local
            capacity and the market environment. 3) Programmatic lending
            provides the Bank with more flexibility in supporting the
            Government's reform agenda and permits the build-up of
            a broader policy dialogue. 4) A comprehensive and complex
            policy reform agenda, such as the one supported by this
            project, might have been better served by a Program
            consisting of more than two loan operations

6424433.trustfund:
TF030448-SPANISH CTF - FY04 ( LATIN
            AMERICA & CARIBBEAN REGION/FINANCE SECTOR),TF052531-PHRD-COLOMBIA: PROGRAMMATIC
            FINANCIAL SECTOR ADJUSTMENT LOAN SECOND OPE

repnme.cdata!:
Colombia:  Second Programmatic Financial
            Sector Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Programmatic Financial Sector
            Adjustment Loan Project for Colombia aims  to contribute to
            a well capitalized, well regulated, supervised stable, and
            efficient financial system that effectively intermediates
            savings and provides credit, capital, and other financial
            services and products to Colombian investors, consumers, and
            homeowners.  It also aims to facilitate greater domestic and
            foreign investment, reduce the cost of financing, and
            contribute to strengthened competitiveness, higher
            productivity and eventual job creation.  The loan will
            support policy actions under the first phase of the program
            and implement a new legal and regulatory framework for the
            modernization of the securities market and the upgrading of
            risk management norms in the mutual funds, pension,
            insurance and trust industries.

docna.cdata!:
Colombia:  Second Programmatic Financial
            Sector Adjustment Loan Project
